p: Uganda, like many countries in WHO-AFRO region, is disproportionately affected by endemic, emerging and re-emerging communicable disease burden [ 16â€“ 23]. The rapid population expansion, increased human ecosystem interaction and climate change make the country vulnerable to disease outbreaks [ 24]. It is imperative that Uganda has a robust public health surveillance and response system that can effectively detect, respond to these public health threats and mitigate their impact [ 25].
